text: Hey Dudes…and Dudes I am trying to set up a search and have it display newer Items first. Also how does the scoring work?

hmmm. I’ll be honest I’m not sure that’s possible yet.

MColey has explained how scoring worked a few times in the past, I’ll be completely honest it was complicated. You might be able to reverse engineer it slightly as there is a way I guess to output the scores
We are just not getting newer Items in our search

OHHH, as in you posted something recently, searched for a keyword that should for sure pull it up and are not getting a result. I had a similar problem before. I think that the index is updated periodically not upon a site change being made. There is no way to manually force a re-index on our end.
no it was a couple days ago. It is just not showing in resulst.. instead im getting stuff from 8 years ago that have had 20 views all time
yeek, yea thats not right at all. <@U6GNQ7JBU>
Which page?
We boost by view count
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
You can increase how much this boost is through the API
<https://www.bluleadz.com/_hcms/search?type=BLOG_POST&analytics=true&minScore=1&term=facebook>
but ive got a post that is 7 years old that has next to no total views.
but it has a 5.xx score
Let me look into recency scoring
This isn't on by default since it doesn't make sense for site pages but may make sense for blog posts. Let me add an option through the API
<@U38EZFVFE> I updated <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content> with the `boostRecent` query param
Sweet. Thanks.
after i clone the input search, how do i stop it from showing the dropdown?
got that, how do I go about adding a button to the search field input?
the dropdown is all the javascript in that module. the search If I remember right doesn’t need that at all, it actually submits via action
oh and then button, you just add a literal <button> I’m a gumdrop button </button> inside the form element
and by default a sole button becomes the submit button.
yup, got it all sorted
caching seems to be an issue when i update the css though
is it a problem though that only affects you during dev or something that’s going to be an issue for the end user?
looks like i am having caching issues in general on this portal when I update a page as well
<@U6GNQ7JBU> Any thoughts on the caching issues?
for search, is there way to stop the delay in the search results loading or show a "loading" indicator?
right now when you go to the search page from using the input in something like the footer, it shows the search page as it would from default, then about 1 - 2 seconds later the results load
